questions.question: Which famous architectural marvel, designed by Frank Lloyd Wright in 1935, seems to float above a waterfall in Pennsylvania?
questions.context: Revolutionary for its integration with nature, this home was a weekend retreat for the Kaufmann family.

questions.question: During the 16th century, this ancient ruin in Peru was the heart of the Inca Empire and is famously terraced into the mountains. What is it called?
questions.context: Rediscovered by Hiram Bingham in 1911, this site is perched high in the Andes Mountains.

questions.question: This UNESCO World Heritage Site, built in 1632, is an iconic symbol of love and a masterpiece of Mughal architecture. What is it?
questions.context: Commissioned by Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal, this marble mausoleum draws millions of visitors annually.

questions.question: Which city is both the capital of Greece and home to the ancient Parthenon temple?
questions.context: As the cradle of democracy and Western civilization, this city hosted the first modern Olympic Games in 1896.

questions.question: Built in the 15th to 17th centuries, which sprawling castle complex in Northern Poland was a strategic military site during notable battles such as the Battle of Grunwald?
questions.context: Originally a fortress for the Teutonic Knights, this castle is the largest brick castle in the world by surface area.
